forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly cloudy, with a low around 50. Southwest wind around 3 mph.

forecast.name: Thursday
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly sunny. High near 68, with temperatures falling to around 66 in the afternoon. Southwest wind 2 to 10 mph.

weather_report:
As the early morning grips Downtown San Francisco, the city is cloaked in a gentle veil of clouds, whispering promises of the day ahead. The air is calm, barely ruffled by a soft breeze that drifts through the avenues, carrying the coolness of the night. Currently, temperatures are resting comfortably in the mid-fifties—a serene backdrop for the hustle of the awakening city. The forecast hints at a transition as the sun climbs higher, dropping the clouds for bursts of golden brilliance that will grace the skyline later in the day. By afternoon, expect a delightful warmth, with highs flirting around sixty-eight degrees, inviting residents and visitors alike to bask in the emerging sunshine.

As the day progresses, the marine layer will likely recede, revealing the city in its full vibrancy. The landscape—marked by the iconic Golden Gate Bridge—should emerge from the mist, inviting leisurely strolls along the waterfront or explorations of the winding streets adorned with colorful murals and eclectic shops. Dress in layers to adapt to the shifting temperatures, perhaps a light sweater that can be easily shed as the sun’s warmth envelops you. Today calls for exploration—not the usual tourist spots, but quaint, tucked-away cafes or peaceful parks where one can savor a cup of coffee while listening to the hum of city life. Enjoy the canvas that is today, painted with the soft hues of spring.
